critique: The executive order aims to convey a sense of hope and optimism regarding job opportunities and skills development. It also expresses concern about the current state of education and workforce development programs. The order seeks to instill a sense of surprise that current programs are not working as well as they should. It also conveys a sense of disgust that taxpayer money is being wasted on ineffective programs. It also conveys a sense of sadness that many people are struggling to find full-time work. It does not convey a sense of fear or anger.
